intro: Hieracium saxatile, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant features basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central cone-shaped structure. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh climatic conditions. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in high-altitude meadows and is a characteristic species of alpine flora.
